{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about the most effective caustic for treating hypersensitive dentin in molars. We need to look for information related to etching patterns on enamel surfaces after treatment with various caustics. The relevant document is 'Managing dentin hypersensitivity: what treatment to recommend to patients.' According to this document, conditioning the enamel is extremely important for prophylactic treatment of caries with sealers. The depth and pattern of etching depend on the agent used. Incisors and molars were etched with seven etching agents. The best etching agent proved to be a 50% solution of H3PO4 + 2% solution of NaF; this agent produced the most even etching pattern, which was greater in molars than incisors.", "answer_choice": "D"
